text: Interferon-alpha ( IFN-alpha ) is a pleiotropic cytokine that has antiviral , antiproliferative , and immunoregulatory functions .
There is increasing evidence that IFN-alpha has an important role in T-cell biology .

We have analyzed the expression of <extra_id_0> IL-2Ralpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> c-myc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> pim-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> genes in anti-CD3 - activated human T lymphocytes .

text: Taken together , our results suggest that IFN-alpha , <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , IL-12 , and <extra_id_0> IL-15 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> have overlapping activities on human T cells .
These findings thus emphasize the importance of IFN-alpha as a T-cell regulatory cytokine .
